meanings.definition: A tightly stretched rope or wire on which acrobats perform
meanings.sent1: The acrobat gracefully balanced on the tightropes.
meanings.sent2: The circus performer walked confidently on the tightropes.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to juggle while standing on the tightropes, causing laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: Life can sometimes feel like walking on tightropes, trying to find balance.
meanings.sent5: The image of the acrobat on the tightropes was etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: To walk or perform on a tightrope
meanings.sent1: She practiced diligently to tightropes across the stage without falling.
meanings.sent2: The daredevil decided to tightropes over the canyon for a thrilling stunt.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to tightropes along the narrow fence, showing off its agility.
meanings.sent4: Balancing work and family responsibilities can feel like tightropes through a busy day.
meanings.sent5: He had to tightropes carefully to navigate the tricky situation.
